title: Deals: Apple Pencil Pro and USB-C undercut Prime Day from $65, 36GB MacBook Pro $500 off, Apple Watch, more
description: While the 2024 fall Prime Day event is now behind us, that doesn’t mean the deals are. In fact, both Apple Pencil Pro and the USB-C model have dropped in price again to new all-time lows starting from $65 shipped to join a new deal on the 2nd gen variant. We are also still tracking the lowest prices ever on the black titanium Apple Watch Ultra 2, the new Beats Solo Buds, and AirPods Max with USB-C alongside this monster monster M3 Pro Max MacBook Pro with 36GB of RAM at $500 off the price you’ll pay from Apple. All of this and more awaits down below in today’s 9to5toys Lunch Break.  more…
author: Justin Kahn
excerpt: While the 2024 fall Prime Day event is now behind us, that doesn’t mean the deals are. In fact, both...
text: While the 2024 fall Prime Day event is now behind us, that doesn’t mean the deals are. In fact, both Apple Pencil Pro and the USB-C model have dropped in price again to new all-time lows starting from $65 shipped to join a new deal on the 2nd gen variant. We are also still tracking the lowest prices ever on the black titanium Apple Watch Ultra 2, the new Beats Solo Buds, and AirPods Max with USB-C alongside this monster monster M3 Pro Max MacBook Pro with 36GB of RAM at $500 off the price you’ll pay from Apple. All of this and more awaits down below in today’s 9to5toys Lunch Break.  Apple Pencil 2nd Gen falls from $129 to $80 today, joins new lows on Apple Pencil Pro and USB-C model from $65 The new Apple Pencil Pro with Find My did see its best price ever for Prime Day and has, in fact, dropped a couple bucks lower over the last 12 hours to land at the $96 Amazon all-time low. But one deal that went live later in the day yesterday only the sneak under the radar was the Apple Pencil (2nd Generation) down at $79.99 shipped. Whereas the Apple Pencil Pro is really only for M4 iPad Pro and M2 iPad Air users, the 2nd Gen is geared towards a much broader collection of iPad releases – iPad mini (6th generation), iPad Air (4th or 5th generation), iPad Pro 12.9-inch (3rd, 4th, 5th, or 6th generation), iPad Pro 11-inch (1st, 2nd, 3rd, or 4th generation).  We have attempted to simplify the lineup right here plus you’ll find Apple’s compatibility list here. And just below, you’ll find discounted pricing across the Apple Pencil lineup for whatever Apple tablet you might own: Apple Pencil (USB-C) $65 (Reg. $79) | All-time low Apple Pencil Pro $96 (Reg. $129) | All-time low Apple Pencil 2nd Gen $80 (Reg. $129) Apple Pencil 1st Gen $80 (Reg. $99) Apple’s monster M3 Max MacBook Pro with 36GB of RAM sees giant $500 price drop Update: While the 48GB beast below has jumped up $100, we spotted another monster of a MacBook seeing a huge price drop at Best Buy – the M3 Pro Max MacBook Pro with 36GB of RAM and a 1TB SSD down at $2,999 shipped, or $500 off the regular $3,499 list price. More details below. For some folks the measly 18GB of RAM and that M3 Pro chip just isn’t enough. I’m not one of them, but if you are Amazon is offering a massive $600 in savings on Apple’s super high-end M3 Pro Max MacBook Pro today at$3,399 $3,499 shipped. That’s not cheap by any means, but this is a $3,999 configuration loaded with 48GB of RAM back at the lowest price we have ever tracked. This model has only dropped this low a couple times before today in very quick one-day sales. This is also $100 under the discount price you’ll find at Best Buy right now.  New black black titanium Apple Watch Ultra 2 still at best price ever for Prime Day at $730 shipped Amazon’s Prime Big Deal Days event is now ushering in all-time low pricing on the new black titanium Apple Watch Ultra 2. The black titanium Apple Watch Ultra 2 configuration has now dropped to $729.99 shipped with your choice of the Black Trail Loop or the new Dark Green Alpine Loop as well as the Black Ocean Band. The new black titanium Ultra 2 was unveiled and released last month with the same MSRP as the natural titanium model at $799, but has now dropped to its best price ever for the fall Prime Day event at Amazon.  Anker’s new 14-port Anker Prime Docking Station now $5 under Prime Day low at $175 (Reg. $250), more One of our top 10 Prime Day deals was the 2024 Anker Prime lineup, featuring a series of charging solutions and the 14-port Anker Prime Docking Station. This regularly $250 USB-C/A hub fell to $212.49 before dropping again to $180 for day 2 of the Amazon fall event, and now it is sitting at the $174.99 shipped all-time low. There’s no telling how long this straight up 30% price drop will stick around for considering it is in some ways a hangover Prime Day deal, so you’ll want to jump as soon as possible if you’re interested.  Anker Prime 250W Charging Station $119 (Reg. $170) Anker Prime 9,600mAh Power Bank $75 (Reg. $90) Anker Prime 240W Flat Charging Station $100 (Reg. $165) Anker Prime 14-port Docking Station $175 (Reg. $250) Twelve South debuts new 15W Qi2 HiRise 2 Deluxe MagSafe stand today, here’s some early hands-on impressions Today’s accessories and charging deals: This aluminum MagSafe desk stand with a flexible design is yours for $15 Razer’s Key Light Chroma RGB is ready to add some colors to your setup at $150 TP-Link’s Kasa outdoor smart plug plunges to new $8.50 low This PS5 wall mount holds two DualSense controllers and a headset at under $17 All-new Beats Solo Buds in Transparent Red, Matte black, more hit $50 Amazon all-time low today (Reg. $80) While we did see a price drop on the Arctic Purple set at Target previously, Amazon’s Prime Big Deal Days event is delivering the very first price drops on the new Beats Solo Buds in Transparent Red, Storm Gray, and Matte Black at $49.99 shipped. This is a regularly $80 set of 2024 earbuds that were just release recently seeing a deep 38% price drop to deliver not only the first deal, but also a subsequent Amazon all-time low in the process.  Brand new Beats Pill speaker with Find My just dropped again to new $100 low for Prime Day (Reg. $150) Best fall Prime Day MagSafe stand deal now live – Twelve South HiRise 3 Deluxe now at $106.50 all-time low We saw a major deal on one of the best official 15W 3-in-1 MagSafe stands for Prime Day this past summer, but the Twelve South HiRise 3 Deluxe is now even more affordable for Prime Big Deal Days. One of our absolute favorite options, the regularly $150 Twelve South HiRise 3 Deluxe has now dropped to $106.49 shipped for the fall Prime Day event at Amazon and on the official Twelve South site. That’s a nearly unheard of 30% in savings, one of the very best deals we have ever tracked on one of the best MagSafe stands out there, and an offer that undercuts the summer Prime Day deal we featured at $125. Needless to say, this is a very good deal and one you don’t want to miss if you have your eye on one of these charging stands.  Twelve South’s flagship AirFly Pro Deluxe in-flight AirPods transmitter hits all-time low at $52 Price dropped again – Apple’s new 25W MagSafe charger now even lower starting from $33 Update 3: The prices on both models have now dropped even lower once again with the 1-meter model down at $32.78 and the 2m variant for $43.50 shipped. If you just picked up an iPhone 16, there is only one charger out there that can juice it up at the full 25W, as we detailed previously. Apple unleashed the next-generation of its MagSafe puck-style cable charger just as the iPhone 16 did, and we are now tracking the first deals. These are by no means massive price drops, but if you’re looking to scoop up the fastest MagSafe charger in the game right now for your new iPhone 16, these are the best prices yet. Amazon is offering the 1-meter model down at $37 and the 2m variant for $47 shipped. More details below.  Apple’s new USB-C AirPods Max in Midnight, purple, and orange drop to $500 all-time low ($49 off) I, for one, did not expect to see this deal today, but Amazon’s Prime Big Deal Days event is ushering in the very first chance to save on on the brand new AirPods Max Wireless Over-Ear Headphones with USB-C at $499.99 shipped. Regularly $549, this set just debuted last month and is now already seeing a solid $49 price drop. This deal price is only live on the new Midnight, purple, and orange colorways. But you will want to keep in mind that the nearly identical original AirPods Max headphones are down at $395 shipped right now – the only difference between the two is the new USB-C port instead of the Lightning on the originals and the fresh paint jobs.  Now even lower: New 46mm silver Apple Watch Series 10 hits all-time low at $406, plus cell and titanium deals It’s not the lowest price we have tracked to date on the brand new 46mm Apple Watch Series 10, but Amazon is now offering the best price we have seen on the silver model. You can now score the new 46mm Apple Watch Series 10 with the silver aluminum case and the sport band down at $412.99 $405.99 shipped. We did see the regularly $429 Apple wearable very quickly dip to $399 on the Jet Black color, but if you have your eye on the silver this is the lowest price yet. All Series 10 models are still up at full price via Best Buy for comparison’s sake.  42mm Apple Watch Series 10 from $381 (Reg. $399) Or with Cell from $476 46mm Apple Watch Series 10 from $413 (Reg. $429) Or with Cell from $508 42mm titanium Apple Watch Series 10 from $674 (Reg. $699) 46mm titanium Apple Watch Series 10 from $713 (Reg. $749) Fall Prime Day offer on the M3 MacBook Air at $275 off might be the best Apple laptop deal all year One of the very first fall Prime Day price drops we spotted this year was on the latest M3 MacBook Air configurations with the 13-inch models dropped back to the best prices ever from $849. Those deals, which include the 8GB and upgraded 16GB of RAM models, are indeed still live but one particularly fantastic price drop is still flying too far under the radar. Apple latest 15-inch M3 MacBook Air is actually now sitting at the best prices ever, undercutting the July Prime Day sale and the wild back-to-school offers we spotted. The regularly $1,299 8GB/256GB configuration is down at $1,044 shipped and the 15-incher with 16GB of RAM and a 512GB SSD is now at $1,424 shipped from the usual $1,699. Thats up to $275 off and the lowest prices we have ever tracked.  13-inch MacBook Air M3 8GB/256GB $849 (Reg. $1,099) 15-inch MacBook Air M3 8GB/256GB $1,044 (Reg. $1,299) 15-inch MacBook Air M3 8GB/512GB $1,234 (Reg. $1,499)  15-inch MacBook Air M3 16GB/512GB $1,424 (Reg. $1,699)  Tested: Hands-on with UAG’s military-style iPhone 16 Civilian case – my favorite protective cover yet Tested: OtterBox Lumen iPhone 16 case – a perfect conductive Camera Control button with limited design options Tested: hands-on with Native Union’s cross-hatched eco leather iPhone 16 case Tested: Nomad’s Magnetic Leather Back case lets iPhone 16 shine like a star, but you better not drop it Tested: Hands-on with Nomad’s full-wrap Traditional Leather iPhone 16 case – the best just got even better Tested: Burton Goods iPhone 16 Heritage case – American leather at its finest with one flaw Tested: Hands-on with Spigen’s Ultra T iPhone 16 Camera Control case…it might make the button even easier to use [Deal] EXCLUSIVE: Arc’s metal iPhone 16 bumper cases are now live, here’s a deal just for 9to5 readers EXCLUSIVE: Atom Studios MagSafe eco leather backplate iPhone 16 cases are 20% off just for 9to5 readers EXCLUSIVE: Here’s an exclusive deal on SANDMARC’s gorgeous new leather iPhone 16 cases from $40 EXCLUSIVE: SANDMARC debuts new titanium band to match new black Apple Watch Ultra 2 – exclusive deal for 9to5 readers  EXCLUSIVE: Burton Goods’ new leather iPhone 16 cases and MagSafe wallets 20% off EXCLUSIVE: Laser anything you want into Alto’s new natural wood iPhone 16 cases New iPhone 16 cases from Spigen now start from under $16 with delivery day deals Totallee’s 0.02-inch thick, logo-free iPhone 16 cases hit all-time lows from $26 (25% off) Watch 9to5Toys on YouTube: Subscribe to the 9to5Toys YouTube Channel for all of the latest videos, reviews, and more! html:
While the 2024 fall Prime Day event is now behind us, that doesn’t mean the deals are. In fact, both Apple Pencil Pro and the USB-C model have dropped in price again to new all-time lows starting from $65 shipped to join a new deal on the 2nd gen variant. We are also still tracking the lowest prices ever on the black titanium Apple Watch Ultra 2, the new Beats Solo Buds, and AirPods Max with USB-C alongside this monster monster M3 Pro Max MacBook Pro with 36GB of RAM at $500 off the price you’ll pay from Apple. All of this and more awaits down below in today’s 9to5toys Lunch Break. 

Apple Pencil 2nd Gen falls from $129 to $80 today, joins new lows on Apple Pencil Pro and USB-C model from $65

The new Apple Pencil Pro with Find My did see its best price ever for Prime Day and has, in fact, dropped a couple bucks lower over the last 12 hours to land at the $96 Amazon all-time low. But one deal that went live later in the day yesterday only the sneak under the radar was the Apple Pencil (2nd Generation) down at $79.99 shipped. Whereas the Apple Pencil Pro is really only for M4 iPad Pro and M2 iPad Air users, the 2nd Gen is geared towards a much broader collection of iPad releases – iPad mini (6th generation), iPad Air (4th or 5th generation), iPad Pro 12.9-inch (3rd, 4th, 5th, or 6th generation), iPad Pro 11-inch (1st, 2nd, 3rd, or 4th generation). 

We have attempted to simplify the lineup right here plus you’ll find Apple’s compatibility list here. And just below, you’ll find discounted pricing across the Apple Pencil lineup for whatever Apple tablet you might own:

  • Apple Pencil (USB-C) $65 (Reg. $79) | All-time low
  • Apple Pencil Pro $96 (Reg. $129) | All-time low
  • Apple Pencil 2nd Gen $80 (Reg. $129)
  • Apple Pencil 1st Gen $80 (Reg. $99)

Apple’s monster M3 Max MacBook Pro with 36GB of RAM sees giant $500 price drop

Update: While the 48GB beast below has jumped up $100, we spotted another monster of a MacBook seeing a huge price drop at Best Buy – the M3 Pro Max MacBook Pro with 36GB of RAM and a 1TB SSD down at $2,999 shipped, or $500 off the regular $3,499 list price. More details below.

For some folks the measly 18GB of RAM and that M3 Pro chip just isn’t enough. I’m not one of them, but if you are Amazon is offering a massive $600 in savings on Apple’s super high-end M3 Pro Max MacBook Pro today at$3,399 $3,499 shipped. That’s not cheap by any means, but this is a $3,999 configuration loaded with 48GB of RAM back at the lowest price we have ever tracked. This model has only dropped this low a couple times before today in very quick one-day sales. This is also $100 under the discount price you’ll find at Best Buy right now. 

New black black titanium Apple Watch Ultra 2 still at best price ever for Prime Day at $730 shipped

Amazon’s Prime Big Deal Days event is now ushering in all-time low pricing on the new black titanium Apple Watch Ultra 2. The black titanium Apple Watch Ultra 2 configuration has now dropped to $729.99 shipped with your choice of the Black Trail Loop or the new Dark Green Alpine Loop as well as the Black Ocean Band. The new black titanium Ultra 2 was unveiled and released last month with the same MSRP as the natural titanium model at $799, but has now dropped to its best price ever for the fall Prime Day event at Amazon. 

Anker’s new 14-port Anker Prime Docking Station now $5 under Prime Day low at $175 (Reg. $250), more

One of our top 10 Prime Day deals was the 2024 Anker Prime lineup, featuring a series of charging solutions and the 14-port Anker Prime Docking Station. This regularly $250 USB-C/A hub fell to $212.49 before dropping again to $180 for day 2 of the Amazon fall event, and now it is sitting at the $174.99 shipped all-time low. There’s no telling how long this straight up 30% price drop will stick around for considering it is in some ways a hangover Prime Day deal, so you’ll want to jump as soon as possible if you’re interested. 

  • Anker Prime 250W Charging Station $119 (Reg. $170)
  • Anker Prime 9,600mAh Power Bank $75 (Reg. $90)
  • Anker Prime 240W Flat Charging Station $100 (Reg. $165)
  • Anker Prime 14-port Docking Station $175 (Reg. $250)

Twelve South debuts new 15W Qi2 HiRise 2 Deluxe MagSafe stand today, here’s some early hands-on impressions

Today’s accessories and charging deals:

  • This aluminum MagSafe desk stand with a flexible design is yours for $15
  • Razer’s Key Light Chroma RGB is ready to add some colors to your setup at $150
  • TP-Link’s Kasa outdoor smart plug plunges to new $8.50 low
  • This PS5 wall mount holds two DualSense controllers and a headset at under $17

All-new Beats Solo Buds in Transparent Red, Matte black, more hit $50 Amazon all-time low today (Reg. $80)

While we did see a price drop on the Arctic Purple set at Target previously, Amazon’s Prime Big Deal Days event is delivering the very first price drops on the new Beats Solo Buds in Transparent Red, Storm Gray, and Matte Black at $49.99 shipped. This is a regularly $80 set of 2024 earbuds that were just release recently seeing a deep 38% price drop to deliver not only the first deal, but also a subsequent Amazon all-time low in the process. 

Brand new Beats Pill speaker with Find My just dropped again to new $100 low for Prime Day (Reg. $150)

Best fall Prime Day MagSafe stand deal now live – Twelve South HiRise 3 Deluxe now at $106.50 all-time low

We saw a major deal on one of the best official 15W 3-in-1 MagSafe stands for Prime Day this past summer, but the Twelve South HiRise 3 Deluxe is now even more affordable for Prime Big Deal Days. One of our absolute favorite options, the regularly $150 Twelve South HiRise 3 Deluxe has now dropped to $106.49 shipped for the fall Prime Day event at Amazon and on the official Twelve South site. That’s a nearly unheard of 30% in savings, one of the very best deals we have ever tracked on one of the best MagSafe stands out there, and an offer that undercuts the summer Prime Day deal we featured at $125. Needless to say, this is a very good deal and one you don’t want to miss if you have your eye on one of these charging stands. 

Twelve South’s flagship AirFly Pro Deluxe in-flight AirPods transmitter hits all-time low at $52

Price dropped again – Apple’s new 25W MagSafe charger now even lower starting from $33

Update 3: The prices on both models have now dropped even lower once again with the 1-meter model down at $32.78 and the 2m variant for $43.50 shipped.

If you just picked up an iPhone 16, there is only one charger out there that can juice it up at the full 25W, as we detailed previously. Apple unleashed the next-generation of its MagSafe puck-style cable charger just as the iPhone 16 did, and we are now tracking the first deals. These are by no means massive price drops, but if you’re looking to scoop up the fastest MagSafe charger in the game right now for your new iPhone 16, these are the best prices yet. Amazon is offering the 1-meter model down at $37 and the 2m variant for $47 shipped. More details below. 

Apple’s new USB-C AirPods Max in Midnight, purple, and orange drop to $500 all-time low ($49 off)

I, for one, did not expect to see this deal today, but Amazon’s Prime Big Deal Days event is ushering in the very first chance to save on on the brand new AirPods Max Wireless Over-Ear Headphones with USB-C at $499.99 shipped. Regularly $549, this set just debuted last month and is now already seeing a solid $49 price drop. This deal price is only live on the new Midnight, purple, and orange colorways. But you will want to keep in mind that the nearly identical original AirPods Max headphones are down at $395 shipped right now – the only difference between the two is the new USB-C port instead of the Lightning on the originals and the fresh paint jobs. 

Now even lower: New 46mm silver Apple Watch Series 10 hits all-time low at $406, plus cell and titanium deals

It’s not the lowest price we have tracked to date on the brand new 46mm Apple Watch Series 10, but Amazon is now offering the best price we have seen on the silver model. You can now score the new 46mm Apple Watch Series 10 with the silver aluminum case and the sport band down at $412.99 $405.99 shipped. We did see the regularly $429 Apple wearable very quickly dip to $399 on the Jet Black color, but if you have your eye on the silver this is the lowest price yet. All Series 10 models are still up at full price via Best Buy for comparison’s sake. 

  • 42mm Apple Watch Series 10 from $381 (Reg. $399)
    • Or with Cell from $476
  • 46mm Apple Watch Series 10 from $413 (Reg. $429)
    • Or with Cell from $508
  • 42mm titanium Apple Watch Series 10 from $674 (Reg. $699)
  • 46mm titanium Apple Watch Series 10 from $713 (Reg. $749)

Fall Prime Day offer on the M3 MacBook Air at $275 off might be the best Apple laptop deal all year

One of the very first fall Prime Day price drops we spotted this year was on the latest M3 MacBook Air configurations with the 13-inch models dropped back to the best prices ever from $849. Those deals, which include the 8GB and upgraded 16GB of RAM models, are indeed still live but one particularly fantastic price drop is still flying too far under the radar. Apple latest 15-inch M3 MacBook Air is actually now sitting at the best prices ever, undercutting the July Prime Day sale and the wild back-to-school offers we spotted. The regularly $1,299 8GB/256GB configuration is down at $1,044 shipped and the 15-incher with 16GB of RAM and a 512GB SSD is now at $1,424 shipped from the usual $1,699. Thats up to $275 off and the lowest prices we have ever tracked. 

  • 13-inch MacBook Air M3 8GB/256GB $849 (Reg. $1,099)
  • 15-inch MacBook Air M3 8GB/256GB $1,044 (Reg. $1,299)
  • 15-inch MacBook Air M3 8GB/512GB $1,234 (Reg. $1,499) 
  • 15-inch MacBook Air M3 16GB/512GB $1,424 (Reg. $1,699) 

Tested: Hands-on with UAG’s military-style iPhone 16 Civilian case – my favorite protective cover yet

Tested: OtterBox Lumen iPhone 16 case – a perfect conductive Camera Control button with limited design options

Tested: hands-on with Native Union’s cross-hatched eco leather iPhone 16 case

Tested: Nomad’s Magnetic Leather Back case lets iPhone 16 shine like a star, but you better not drop it

Tested: Hands-on with Nomad’s full-wrap Traditional Leather iPhone 16 case – the best just got even better

Tested: Burton Goods iPhone 16 Heritage case – American leather at its finest with one flaw

Tested: Hands-on with Spigen’s Ultra T iPhone 16 Camera Control case…it might make the button even easier to use [Deal]

EXCLUSIVE: Arc’s metal iPhone 16 bumper cases are now live, here’s a deal just for 9to5 readers

EXCLUSIVE: Atom Studios MagSafe eco leather backplate iPhone 16 cases are 20% off just for 9to5 readers

EXCLUSIVE: Here’s an exclusive deal on SANDMARC’s gorgeous new leather iPhone 16 cases from $40

EXCLUSIVE: SANDMARC debuts new titanium band to match new black Apple Watch Ultra 2 – exclusive deal for 9to5 readers 

EXCLUSIVE: Burton Goods’ new leather iPhone 16 cases and MagSafe wallets 20% off

EXCLUSIVE: Laser anything you want into Alto’s new natural wood iPhone 16 cases

New iPhone 16 cases from Spigen now start from under $16 with delivery day deals
